pros: Remote, flexible and the people are great
cons: There are many barriers to get through to get work done

review_title: A visionary organization with ambitious goals and employees
pros:
An innovative and mission driven organization
Creative outside-the-box research on healthcare systems improvement
Super smart people from many disciplines 
Well-funded especially for a nonprofit
Affiliated with Harvard School of Public Health 
Affiliated with Brigham and Women's Hospital
Well known global thought leader founded the organization
Constant growth means new opportunities
cons:
HR infrastructure has not kept pace with the rapid growth
Benefits (and union status) differ depending on whether one is hired as an HSPH employee or BWH one, which can be arbitrary
Growing pains evident for employees, especially re: organizational roles
Leadership turns over quickly in some departments

pros: Respect for all employees is evident; new COO shares more about infrastructure and plans than any company I've ever been in.
cons: Growing so fast it's hard to keep up; would benefit from continuous website updates

pros: Really great HR department and all of the people there
cons: There seems to be a lot of turn over which can be hard

pros: Great onboarding process for junior staff members

cons: There are many barriers to get through to get work done
